stem: The nurse is preparing to leave the room of a client on contact and droplet precautions. Place the steps for doffing personal protective equipment (PPE) in the correct order.

options.text: Remove the goggles or face shield.

pedagogy.nclexCategory: Safety and Infection Prevention and Control

rationale.correct: Doffing sequence prevents self-contamination by removing the most contaminated items first. (1) Gloves are the dirtiest. (2) Goggles/Face shield. (3) Gown (peel away from the body). (4) Mask (removed last because it protects the airway during the rest of the doffing). (5) Hand hygiene is the final safety step.
rationale.incorrect: Removing the mask before the gloves is incorrect because your dirty hands would be near your face.
clinicalPearls: The respirator/mask should be removed *after* leaving the room (outside the door) to avoid inhaling airborne pathogens.

questionTrap.howToOvercome: Remember that you take off PPE in alphabetical order: Gloves, Goggles, Gown, Mask (Wait, that's almost alphabetical!).

reviewUnits.heading: Standard and Transmission-Based Precautions
reviewUnits.body: Nurses must follow specific sequences. If hands become contaminated at any point during doffing, perform hand hygiene before continuing.
